page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The main physical features of this region are:a scarp and dip slope running noth-south along the eastern edge;the river Witham, which meanders away to the north-east and a ridge of higher ground intruding from the north. This intrusion causes a natural fork for the A607 to branch to Sleaford becoming the A153. The only settlement of note is the village of Honington which is situated in the fork of the roads on the higher ground.The village church is dedicated to St. Wilfred and has an adjacent open churchyard. There is a small social club operated from the building which had previously housed the school. Evidence of a roman camp can be seen on the dip slope to the east of the village.
